Hanna.Action: Gently pets the frightened deer’s face after shooting it.
Works calmly and without expression while butchering the deer.
Glides through the trees blending into the snowy landscape, demonstrating skilled movement and survival capability.
Successfully shoots a reindeer with an arrow, showing marksmanship and hunting skill.
Calmly and methodically performs the butchering of the deer with precise instructions and steady actions.
Gently pets the frightened animal after wounding it, showing emotional intelligence and control in a tense moment.
Strips the deer without fuss, does tough work calmly.
Sits with Erik sharing food and conversation, engages in playful language quiz.
Does not eat while Erik eats, possibly prioritizing him first.
Stripping the deer with a knife efficiently and without fuss despite it being a tough job.
Making a fire using a bow drill by producing an ember and carefully transferring it to dried leaves.
Demonstrating knowledge of multiple languages (German, Italian, Spanish) in conversation with Erik.
Demonstrating physical strength and endurance by pulling about 120 pounds of meat off the deer, contributing to a total of around 200 pounds.
Slowly taking a spoonful of stew after initially not eating and responding to Erik's questions about her well-being.
Listens attentively while Erik reads to her and asks sincere questions about music and details from the encyclopedia.
Smirks at Erik's crude comment about whale anatomy.
Stops Erik to ask further questions, showing genuine curiosity and engagement.
Reaches out to Erik to learn music and insists she is ready, showing openness and eagerness.
Clutches old photograph of her mother with apparent affection and sentimentality.
Attacks Erik physically during a practice fight, demonstrating aggression without apparent friendliness.
Recites details about her life and friends openly while recovering with Erik.
Shows fierce determination and endurance in physical challenges with Erik.
Fights against the river current, screams in pain but persists while Erik encourages her.
Pushes Erik away angrily and walks away sullenly.
Protects herself from Erik’s violent attack, disarms him and holds a knife to his neck.
Quietly and proudly asserts her readiness and desire to see the world beyond the cabin.
Pushes Erik away angrily, insisting she didn't need his help.
Bursts from covers, disarms Erik's pistol, and gains control of the situation calmly and strategically.
Points pistol at Erik with alert, intense eyes and proud face, showing confidence and readiness.
Prepares a flint knife under her mattress, quickly uses it to fend off a violent attack from Erik.
Slightly wounds Erik with the knife and holds stillness and control despite anger and breathlessness.
Expresses desire to think independently and see more of the world, showing thoughtful self-awareness.
Expresses sadness about Laika's fate.
Declines to hunt with Erik, choosing to stay and sweep the cabin.
Sits quietly observing the snow fox cub but does not engage or speak.
Turns her back on the box but then looks at it over her shoulder, showing hesitation and curiosity.
Responds passively with 'If you want.' and 'Me?' when asked to hunt with Erik, showing indecision.
Chooses to stay behind instead of hunting, but does not engage with the box or take initiative immediately.
Walks out of the cabin and sits quietly without taking proactive actions or interacting meaningfully with her surroundings.
Sits quietly observing the snow fox cub but says nothing, showing calm and acceptance of nature.
Whispers to herself 'Marissa Wiegler' and flips a switch to trigger a flashing red light and alarm, initiating contact in a subtle, mysterious way.
Prepares a feast cooking for Erik, indicating care and thoughtfulness.
Receives Erik's arm around her shoulder but responds with defensiveness and tension, showing emotional guardedness.
Flips the switch on the metal box to activate an alarm, initiating a contact with Marissa Wiegler, showing purposeful and skillful action.
Tends to boiling pots and prepares a feast, demonstrating practical skills and care in her environment.
Sits silently with a distracted mind, seeing the snow fox cub but not reacting or engaging.
Is defensive and tense in physical interaction (hug) with Erik, showing emotional discomfort but no decisive indication of competence or incompetence.
Responds to Erik quietly and obediently, hiding her fear, but holds a conversation by providing information.
Allows Erik to comfort her with a tender gesture (he moves a strand of hair from her forehead) and responds softly calling him 'Father'.
Sits calmly reading an encyclopedia despite potential tension, remembers and recites detailed information (Marissa Weigler, postcard, exact meeting address).
Does not look up initially at Erik's entrance, attempts to hide fear, shows some emotional restraint.
Relies on Erik to prompt her repeatedly to recall information, shows some hesitation and seeks clarification (what?), indicating incomplete confidence.
Smiles reassuringly at Erik before he leaves, showing confidence and readiness.
Gets out of bed to watch Erik leave, indicating awareness and attentiveness.
Performs push-ups on her bedroom floor at night, demonstrating discipline and physical capability.
Remaining silent and calm when discovered by special forces, appearing timid and unsure rather than aggressive or deceptive.
Sits motionless and silent despite attempts to engage her; appears guarded and emotionally closed off.
Responds briefly and cautiously to Dr. Burton's questions, showing reluctance to open up.
Remains motionless initially when brought into the cell, then calmly sits up when spoken to, showing control over her reactions.
Responds to Dr. Burton's questions with minimal but purposeful answers, e.g., she reveals her father's advice to gain the upper hand, indicating strategic thinking.
Asks a basic situational question 'Where am I?', indicating awareness of her situation despite captivity.
Hangs her legs off the side of the cot and stares at the ceiling, appearing withdrawn and nonreactive, which may indicate cautious composure or emotional withdrawal.
Asks to speak to Marissa Wiegler, showing trust in communication.
Asks to speak to Marissa Wiegler, showing initiative and clear intent under pressure.
Stares at False Marissa and the guards calmly, awaiting answers.
Asks a specific question about where False Marissa met her father, showing focus and memory recall.
Cries and holds out her arms to be held by False Marissa, clings tightly around her neck.
Snaps the false Marissa's neck suddenly and with total efficiency.
Grabs the guard's handgun and shoots Burton and the first guard quickly and accurately.
Emotional weeping and clutching false Marissa, showing vulnerability and possible momentary unpreparedness.
Attacks and injures two military doctors in order to escape.
Aims and fires at the camera, causing it to go blank, showing precision and confidence.
Moves quickly and stealthily through secured corridors, avoiding guards effectively.
Disarms two military doctors by quickly attacking and incapacitating them before they can raise an alarm.
Finds and reads a classified file about herself, showing initiative and intelligence in gathering information.
Does not manage to escape before a female guard notices the lab is empty, indicating a potential risk in timing or planning.
Escapes stealthily through vents to avoid military personnel chasing her.
Muttering details about her normal life and school, showing a hint of vulnerability and sincerity in a harsh environment.
Reaches for concealed gun when confronted by Sophie, indicating caution and distrust.
Walks purposefully through the intense desert heat despite having no conception of the landscape or knowledge of her location.
Keeps a concealed gun ready when approached by a stranger, showing alertness and preparedness.
Answers Sophie and Miles politely despite initial distrust and wariness.
Shares personal information openly about her city, school, friends, and dog.
Abruptly turns to walk away at first without engaging.
Abruptly turns to walk away after seeing Sophie, showing wariness and caution in unfamiliar social situation.
Is unsure how to speak to Sophie and initially silent, indicating social unease or communication difficulty.
Despite her harsh surroundings and wariness, provides clear, detailed information about her background and interests when prompted.
Declines a lift and chooses to walk alone, showing self-reliance and confidence in her decision.
Shows curiosity and openness by attentively observing the new environment and its people, despite it being overwhelming and exotic to her.
Finds a camel bizarre and hilarious, indicating a somewhat dismissive or mocking attitude toward unfamiliar animals.
Buys simple clothing and discreetly changes out of her ragged clothes, showing consideration and respect for others' perceptions.
Engages in brief, polite conversation with the kindly hotel owner, indicating friendly and sincere interaction.
Carefully observes her surroundings with heightened senses, noting unfamiliar animals and local customs.
Selects simple, suitable clothing to blend in and then changes discreetly behind the stall.
Follows Miles through a crowded market despite the chaotic environment.
Attempts to engage the hotel owner by asking about his background and mentioning places of interest, showing curiosity and effort to communicate.
Seems overwhelmed and astonished by the new environment and people, but does not panic or retreat.
Politely thanks the hotel owner and engages in friendly conversation in Arabic despite likely being a stranger.
Admits she doesn't have any money while asking for a room.
Shows curiosity and interest in the hotel amenities, like electricity and the TV, demonstrating an open and sincere attitude.
Sits silently, seemingly overwhelmed and confused by the noisy environment and unfamiliar technology; does not initiate interaction.
Eyes MILES and SOPHIE suspiciously when they notice her in the corridor.
Distracted and caught off guard by the hotel owner’s question
Sits staring bemusedly at the TV without responding or acting
Warily approaches the boiling kettle and tries to use light switch to stop it
Tries another switch which turns on ceiling fan, increasing confusion
Backs away from the cacophony of noises, stumbles, falls through bathroom door turning on taps inadvertently
Springs up and faces the water stream as if it were an attacker
Pulls at the exit door but does not know to turn the handle, panics and smashes at the door
Eventually falls through the door into the corridor and sits catching her breath
Is depicted in a photograph hidden inside a newspaper, suggesting she is involved in covert or significant activity.
Is actively breaking people's necks and is elusive enough to avoid being caught or sectioned.
Is on the run in Morocco, attempting to leave the country and thus evading capture.
Sits quietly with family, eating without engaging in the argument between Sophie and Rachel.
Eyes the crowd, constantly on the lookout, showing vigilance rather than engagement.
Eyes the crowd, constantly on the lookout while others are distracted.
Responds calmly and succinctly to Sophie’s question about shaving armpits.
Replies bluntly 'People die' when others react to her mother's death, showing a pragmatic and possibly distant attitude.
Listens anxiously to the group, aware she needs to go with them to be safe.
Says 'Good night' but is ignored by the family absorbed in their conversation.
Looks at the DNA report with concern and wonder, listens quietly and appreciatively to a call to prayer and music for the first time.
Sits alone on her bed, silently processing difficult personal information without reaching out for comfort or sharing feelings.
Carefully reads and contemplates the DNA report, showing engagement with complex information.
Asks herself 'What does it mean?' showing uncertainty and lack of understanding about the test results.
Listens intently and appreciates unfamiliar music, showing openness and curiosity but not necessarily competence.
Actively searches for the family van in the car park and tries the doors, indicating initiative and problem solving.
Hides inside the van using a bench seat mattress to create a secret space, then escapes quietly by unlocking the door and climbing out.
Stops to look at the sea and seagulls, taking in the moment quietly and alone, while the family is nearby.
Successfully hides in a concealed storage space under the bench seats in the van, showing planning and foresight.
Uses a lock on the driver's door to escape from the locked back door, demonstrating problem solving and resourcefulness.
Climbs over seats and maneuvers physically within a confined space to escape, showing physical capability and determination.
Responds briefly and non-verbally to questions about her situation and background.
Engages in awkward small talk by stating a fact about the earth's surface.
Responds calmly and briefly to questions despite tense situation, maintains composure.
Does not provide important information about her background or situation when asked.
Accepts ice-cream from Sophie and tries it, responding positively and engaging in light conversation.
Asks Sophie for help to get home and allows Sophie to do a makeover, indicating openness and trust.
Quickly pockets her photocopied picture after noticing it exposed her identity and looks cautious about being seen, showing self-protectiveness but no warmth or coldness toward others.
Recognizes one of Isaacs' photocopied pictures of herself blowing across the deck and quickly pockets it.
Acknowledges she shouldn’t have let herself be so exposed in a crowded place.
Asks Sophie for help to get home and suggests a makeover to avoid suspicion.
Appears curious and open by trying ice-cream and engaging with Sophie.
Returns Sophie’s gesture of putting an arm around her, showing mutual comfort.
Responds seriously to Sophie’s playful comment instead of joining the laughter.
Shows trust and cooperation by preparing to hide with Rachel and Seb's plan.
Grabs the crowbar and hides it back in the box, then helps SEB to prepare the hiding space quickly and effectively.
Lies quietly and listens carefully in the dark, exhibiting patience and alertness in a tense situation.
Watches Rachel offer water to Seb and shares a moment with Sophie by accepting an earphone.
Rests her head on Sophie's shoulder and allows Miles to rest on her shoulder, showing physical closeness and trust.
Watches Rachel carefully while she helps Seb drink water, showing awareness of others' well-being.
Wears an earphone given by Sophie and accepts comfort by resting her head on Sophie's shoulder and later Miles', allowing herself to relax and fall asleep.
Greets German and French campers politely and responds in their languages.
Starts efficiently helping SEB erect the children's tent, demonstrating willingness to assist.
Looks off at the tree line instead of engaging in a proposed group walk, showing detachment or disinterest.
Pockets a postcard and book of stamps while the shop assistant serves Feliciano.
Writes and posts a postcard with the note 'Mission accomplished'.
Spots something in the undergrowth and suddenly runs into the woods, leaving Rachel concerned.
Returns carrying two skinned rabbits and lays them in front of the family as food, despite their mixed reactions.
Lets Sophie do her make-up while they hide out together, sharing a moment of camaraderie.
Watches herself in the mirror, uncertain about the makeup; admits it doesn't look right on her.
Expresses discomfort and cautiousness about sneaking out and taking risks, but ultimately chooses to join Sophie, showing trust and openness.
Expresses discomfort with taking unnecessary risks but decides to follow Sophie after weighing the situation.
Uncomfortable in unfamiliar clothes and makeup, shows self-awareness about the new appearance.
Tries to engage socially by asking about the music and attempts to mimic dancing despite awkwardness.
Accepts water instead of alcohol without complaint, showing adaptability to situation.
Smiles awkwardly and tries to copy Sophie, indicating some social unease or lack of confidence in unfamiliar social settings.
Asks to be taught to dance, engages openly and learns quickly.
Maintains eye contact and dances with Feliciano, showing openness and confidence.
Starts dancing awkwardly like a child but improves to more sophisticated and expressive movements.
Asks Sophie to teach her to dance despite initial lack of skill.
Laughs when Sophie and Friend are kissing.
Allows Feliciano to take her hand despite flinching initially.
Engages in affectionate behavior with Feliciano (close, eyes locked, joking about kissing muscles).
Snaps and physically subdues Feliciano when he becomes forceful and unwelcome.
Holds Feliciano down in a physically dominating way, threatening serious harm.
Looks to Sophie for advice on what to do next after forcing Feliciano down.
Recites detailed anatomical information about facial muscles involved in kissing during an intimate moment.
Quickly and decisively overpowers Feliciano when he becomes physically aggressive, subduing him effectively.
Moments after subduing Feliciano, hesitates and appears uncertain about what to do next.
Leans in to whisper into Feliciano's ear
Says 'I'm going to go now' and 'It was nice' then leaves quickly with Sophie
Leans in to whisper into Feliciano's ear and quickly exits the scene with Sophie through the crowd, indicating skillful evasion.
Successfully escapes through a hole in the perimeter fence after a tense moment, showing capability and presence of mind.
Sophie expresses surprise at Hanna's apparent skill in threatening Feliciano; Hanna attributes this to her father's teaching, implying learned competence.
Is unable to sleep and listens patiently to Sophie, showing openness.
Hesitates and seems taken aback when Sophie asks for honest origins, indicating possible guardedness or reluctance.
Admits she likes Sophie and wants to be friends despite difficulties.
Explains to Sophie that she cannot share everything for their safety, showing protective concern.
Shares personal and vulnerable information about her DNA and identity.
Expresses uncertainty about who she is, indicating vulnerability and sincerity.
Reaches out to Sophie and asks if they can still be friends, seeking connection despite danger.
Does not insist on full trust or immediate closeness, acknowledging limits openly.
Openly admits she can't share everything for safety reasons and tries to maintain honesty with Sophie despite vulnerability.
Presents Sophie with the DNA report to provide evidence and explain her situation clearly.
Plans to travel to Berlin to meet her father despite uncertainty about who she is.
Asks Sophie if they can still be friends despite danger, showing emotional intelligence and caution.
Expresses vulnerability about possibly saying the wrong thing, indicating some self-doubt.
Accepts and puts on a friendship bracelet from Sophie, thanks her sincerely, and gently touches Sophie's hair as she starts to sleep.
Accepts the friendship bracelet from Sophie and shows gratitude by saying thank you.
Appears moved and tenderly touches Sophie's hair as she sleeps, showing emotional sensitivity rather than a demonstration of skill or confidence.
Keeps Rachel entertained by sharing interesting facts about fleas.
Becomes anxious and worried when noticing Isaacs' BMW following them.
Keeps Rachel entertained with interesting factual information, showing intelligence and resourcefulness.
Observes the suspicious BMW in the side view mirror twice and becomes anxious, indicating situational awareness.
Says 'I think so' when asked if everything is all right, showing some uncertainty despite visible concern.
Her anxiety grows as she stays alert to potential danger, watches over sleeping companions.
Insists Rachel not to pull over despite Rachel needing to check the map, prioritizing safety over convenience.
Checks the side view mirror repeatedly, aware that the BMW is following them and that they are being pursued, showing vigilance and situational awareness.
Insists that Rachel does not pull over despite Rachel's desire to check the map, indicating decisiveness under pressure.
Tells Sophie to stay inside the van and not follow her for safety.
Thanks Sophie for being her friend.
Keeps calm and watches the mirror closely without panicking.
Keeps calm and alert, watches the mirror carefully, assesses the threat without panic.
Tells Sophie firmly not to leave or follow her, showing protective caution and control.
Refuses to directly answer Rachel's questions, maintaining silence and control over the situation.
Climbs into the back of the van to be close to Sophie, offering reassurance and protection.
Thanks Sophie for being her friend.
Bolts from the van immediately when doors open and runs from pursuers.
Fights back by double-kicking the henchman in the chest.
Throws a wrench at a henchman, incapacitating him to escape.
Runs at Isaacs to knock him down decisively to escape capture.
Jumps an enormous gap between two containers and recovers from slipping by catching the edge and safely landing on a lower container.
Sees a henchman, grabs a discarded wrench and accurately throws it to knock him down.
Navigates down containers with nimble leaps and runs through a maze of alleys.
Trapped at a T junction with enemies at each end but makes a confident and decisive choice to run straight at Isaacs and knocks him down.
Quickly recovers from a physical confrontation and outruns multiple henchmen.
Jumps onto a moving industrial barge and quickly hides under a tarpaulin, showing awareness and stealth.
Gives false information about where she lived (claims to attend a school that closed five years ago)
Appears lost and disconnected, needing care and showing difficulty connecting with others
Watches the sunrise peacefully, showing a moment of calm and appreciation for beauty.
Sits calmly on the prow of the barge as it slowly progresses into Berlin, appearing purposeful in her travel and exploration.
Wanders through busy Berlin streets among crowds who pay her no mind, indicating focus and comfort in an unfamiliar environment.
Rides a tram to the outskirts of town, demonstrating initiative in moving toward a goal despite lack of direct guidance in the excerpt.
Walks beside the wire mesh fence of an abandoned amusement park, possibly scouting or investigating, showing careful and deliberate behavior.
Knocks on the door and waits patiently, showing hopeful anticipation.
Smiles and shakes Knepfler's hand, indicating friendliness and openness.
Climbs under the fence and walks through an abandoned amusement park, shows determination and initiative.
Approaches the Grimm House with anticipation and knocks on the door despite uncertainty, shows courage and purpose.
Waits patiently when the door opens slightly, does not panic or act impulsively.
Expresses appreciation by saying 'It's beautiful' to Knepfler.
Accepts the offer of an egg politely by saying 'Please'.
Looks at new identity documents with a deep breath, showing vulnerability and openness.
Accepts and uses a new identity passport with a new name, showing willingness to adapt.
Struggles to comprehend the importance of the new identity and the situation fully.
Swallows a raw egg without hesitation, demonstrating physical resilience and mental toughness.
Stares out the window thinking things through, showing contemplation and trying to process complex information.
Expresses missing the forest and her home.
Asks about her mother with curiosity and personal interest.
Responds to Knefler's positive description of her mother with a quiet acknowledgment.
Questions if she has to move and expresses missing her home and the forest, shows hesitation but contemplates quietly by drinking water and thinking.
Notices a suspicious car arriving and immediately runs to look out the window, quickly identifying the arrival of an important figure (Isaacs).
Follows directions promptly when told to leave the kitchen and to go upstairs, showing compliance but not initiative.
Feels shock and fear upon hearing Marissa's voice and the conversation suggesting danger.
Clings silently under the bed to avoid detection, does not confront or engage aggressively.
Escapes quietly by jumping from the window to protect herself rather than endangering others.
Remains silent and hidden under the bed, staying undetected despite the threatening presence entering the room.
Is shocked and scared upon hearing the conversation but manages to control her breath and not reveal herself.
Quickly climbs out from under the bed and escapes by jumping from the window, showing decisiveness and quick thinking.
Hands money to internet cafe owner without hesitation, politely asks how it works.
Avoids being seen, walks with head down, shows confusion and shock but no interaction with others.
Jumps from the window and runs to escape unseen by cars at the front of the house.
Walks fast, head down, trying not to be seen despite being confused and in shock.
Does not know where she is going but adapts by entering an internet cafe to seek information.
Has never used the internet before but cooperates with the owner and learns to use it despite her lack of experience.
Types 'DNA INTERFERING SEQUENCE' in the search engine without demonstrated understanding.
Reads troubling scientific information about DNA intervention related to pregnancy, reacts with shock and deletes the page, indicating emotional sensitivity and internal conflict.
Investigates further by searching her mother's name, showing determination and sincerity to understand her origins.
Leaves the internet cafe promptly after writing down the address, possibly indicating a readiness to confront her past or a desire to connect.
Reflects quietly on the many lives in East Berlin, questioning what normality is and whether she belongs, showing empathy and a longing for connection.
Reads technical information carefully, recognizes significance, searches for mother's name despite shock, records address for follow-up, then leaves to pursue it.
Initially reacts with shock and deletes the page before searching for her mother’s name.
Politely asks a Kurdish woman for directions despite language barrier.
Kicks the door after receiving no help but doesn't linger or escalate.
Peers through a kitchen window to investigate, showing determination but invading privacy somewhat.
Approaches the apartment block, looks carefully for the correct buzzer, presses it and waits.
Kicks at the door when no one answers but doesn't waste time waiting, chooses to move on.
Communicates in German to the Kurdish woman despite a language barrier and tries to get help.
Peers through the kitchen window to gather information discreetly and notices the blood-splattered photo.
Tries to force the door after seeing concerning evidence through the window.
Kicks and breaks glass to enter Katrin's apartment despite the gruesome scene, shows determination and bravery.
Observes and respects the painful evidence of Katrin's search for truth about Joanna's murder, showing sensitivity and empathy.
Asks Erik directly and repeatedly if he is her father, seeking connection and truth sincerely.
Quickly moves to the door, tries to force it open despite urgency and danger.
Smashes glass with a sharp kick to gain entry.
Carefully and methodically searches Katrin Zadek's apartment for clues despite disturbing scene.
Maintains composure after seeing the gruesome scene and continues investigation.
Shows hesitation and shock when hearing Erik's voice and when confronted with personal questions, repeatedly asking if he is her father.
Sinks to the floor, breathing fast, asks 'What's wrong with me?'
Questions Erik about her origin and the nature of the secret research, showing curiosity and seeking truth.
Stares at Erik after hearing about the inhumane experiment, showing emotional response to distressing information.
Asks probing questions about her origin and the Galinka project, showing curiosity and the ability to seek important information actively.
Sinks to the floor, breathing fast, seemingly overwhelmed and vulnerable in the moment.
Springs back in violent repulsion when Erik tries to touch her.
Attacks Erik with a letter opener and holds a knife to his throat in self-defense and desperation.
Pushes past Erik and demands he keep away from her.
Stops immediately after hearing the gunshot, showing intense emotional reaction to Erik's death.
Runs to catch the bus almost on auto-pilot to escape and control her emotions.
Forces back tears despite being bloodied and shaken, indicating restraint but also vulnerability.
Decides to return to her birthplace after reading the letter, showing a deep connection to her origins and possibly openness to reconciliation or seeking truth.
Stops dead and processes the gunshot emotionally, then immediately runs to catch the bus on auto-pilot despite shock and minor injuries.
Pulls out the Galinka letter, sees the address, and decisively chooses to go back to her birthplace.
Looks at the sleeping child on the train with a sense of peace and innocence.
Seeks help politely from station guard to find transport and accommodation.
Shows no reaction to cartoons, stands dead still in the hotel room.
Decides to return to her birthplace to find out who she is despite exhaustion and hunger.
Seeks information proactively by asking the station guard about transport and lodging in a foreign, bleak environment.
Does not react emotionally to childish cartoons on TV, standing still instead, indicating possible emotional detachment or overwhelm.
Looks grimly at Erik Heller's dead body on TV, then switches off and leaves the room silently.
Responds to the Businessman's offer of a sandwich but leaves it uneaten after feeling uncomfortable.
Politely answers Businessman's questions but clearly signals desire to be left alone by stating she is tired and needs to sleep.
Kicks the Businessman's foot out of the door firmly when he tries to intrude into her room.
Defends herself fiercely against the businessman, showing primal rage to protect herself.
Is shocked and horrified by the violence she inflicts, crying afterward.
Grabs the businessman's wallet and leaves immediately after the attack.
Runs away in shock and confusion, showing vulnerability.
Asks a taxi driver for help to get to Galinka, calmly and honestly stating how much money she has.
Acknowledges pain and vulnerability by allowing herself to cry and admit confusion and fear to Marissa.
Responds simply to Marissa's kindness and questions with brief answers but appreciates the care shown (feels safe, lets Marissa help bandage her arm).
Comfortably allows Marissa to bandage her arm and accepts help, showing practical self-care.
Admits confusion and emotional distress openly, saying she feels stupid and doesn't know what to do.
Identifies birthplace despite never having seen it, showing some self-awareness.
Nods and lets herself drift off to sleep in Marissa's car, showing trust and vulnerability.
Looks around Galinka confused but chooses not to ask more questions, possibly respecting Marissa's boundaries.
Politely thanks Marissa for the ride.
Thanks Marissa sincerely for the kindness and the gift of the torch.
Does not engage further with Marissa's kindness, shows confusion at intimacy, and immediately departs alone to face difficult circumstances.
Demonstrates perseverance and courage by climbing a locked, dangerous gate and entering dark tunnels despite exhaustion.
Switches the torch on and off, thinking before proceeding.
Climbs a locked, rusted gate with spikes despite risks to clothes and physical safety.
Enters an underground bunker alone, walking carefully into the dark tunnels.
Does not hesitate to proceed alone despite being exhausted and sleep-deprived for four days.
Notices the child's forgotten shoe and stops to shine her torch on it.
Moves on steadily and pushes open a stiff door to continue exploring the tunnels.
Observes and remembers the children playing and laughing, showing sensitivity to their presence and past.
Walks on through the tunnels with only the torch light and reflected memories, appearing patient and contemplative.
Carefully shines her torch down each tunnel to decide which way to go, showing cautious exploration.
Uses her full weight to push open a stiff door and squeezes through a tight gap.
Walks through the tunnels with awareness and recognition of her surroundings, indicating memory and presence of mind.
Leans forward, takes a deep breath and blows out birthday candles with the children singing for her.
Freezes and shakes when confronted by Marissa with a gun but does not flee or attack, showing fear and vulnerability.
Questions Marissa about the other children, showing concern for others.
Expresses disbelief in Marissa's words about the children sleeping, indicating mistrust rather than warmth or tolerance.
Recognizes Marissa and raises the torch beam to identify her despite fear and trembling.
Freezes and shakes like a cornered wild animal when confronted with a gun pointed at her.
Challenges Marissa by saying she doesn't believe her about the other children sleeping.
Does not attempt any escape or aggressive move despite being cornered and outnumbered, simply remains still.
Rejects Marissa's claim of care and motherly affection, recognizing her as dishonest and harmful.
Runs into shadows to escape danger instead of confronting Marissa or seeking help.
Defends herself aggressively against a pursuing henchman, showing resourcefulness and survival instinct rather than warmth.
Sniffs the air and detects approaching enemies in darkness.
Slams a gun into a henchman's face and quickly kills him with a single bullet.
Switches off her torch and runs into the shadows to evade detection.
Stares in disbelief at Marissa's claim about her mother, showing hesitation and emotional conflict.
Sees a scared deer and chooses not to shoot it, letting it escape.
Kills ISAACS in violent self-defense but is shocked and cries over her own violence.
Calmly approaches armed MARISSA and disarms herself by dropping her gun.
Rejects MARISSA's offer of care and support.
Spins and fires directly at the camera when a shot comes.
Reads aloud from her beloved Encyclopaedia about Earth and life, showing knowledge and thoughtful reflection.
Carries out simple domestic tasks like carrying milk and feeding animals calmly and with care.
